title: The WAGs who have waded into the Coleen Rooney and Rebekah Vardy spat - and the sides they are on
text:

Coleen Rooney and Rebekah Vardy have had a huge falling out, which has played out in a very public war of the WAGs.

Wayne Rooney's wife accused Jamie Vardy's missus of selling stories about her to the press after she allegedly caught her lifting posts from her private Instagram account.

And as the friendship came to an explosive end, other wives and girlfriends of footballers have quickly picked sides.

From Danielle Lloyd to Lizzie Cundy, battle lines have been firmly drawn up in a war that's showing no signs of reaching a peaceful end.

But who's on whose side? And what have they said about the greatest celebrity beef of the year? Here's everything you need to know.

Danielle Lloyd

(Image: Ken McKay/ITV/REX)

poll loading Was Coleen right to publicly name Vardy as leak? 500+ VOTES SO FAR YES NO

Team Coleen

The most vocal of the anti-Vardy brigade has been Danielle Lloyd.

She appeared on This Morning on Thursday to say she thought the allegations against her were ture.

Danielle, 35, said: "It's definitely come out of Becky's account. I think she did it. Sadly I really do. It's a shame as she probably didn't think she was going to get caught out.

"I think that if she was feeding the press, maybe she would get more headlines for herself. I could never do that to somebody."

(Image: RebekahVardy/Twitter)

(Image: Twitter)

Video Loading Video Unavailable Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now

Rebekah took to Twitter to hit back at the claims, saying: "Danielle Lloyd making false claims on @thismorning that we have had ‘similar run-ins’ is utter b*****ks. She is just fuming that I 'didn't get Jamie recruiting' for her like she asked me to..."

And then Danielle accused her of being The Sun's Secret Wag columnist who anonymously writes scathing articles about footballers' wives and girlfriends.

She posted: "@RebekahVardy do you mean like how the sun recruited you Luv! #secretwag.

"We are all entitled to our opinions and we all know it came from your account.️ Attacking me won’t take that away another low blow by you #notagirlsgirl."

Nicola McLean

Team Rebekah

Nicola McLean, 38, came out in support of Rebekah on The Jeremy Vine Show on Thursday morning.

She claimed her mate "cannot stop crying" and has been forced to take her kids out of school because of the backlash.

The 38-year-old, who is married Tom Williams, said: "I don't know Coleen but I do know Rebekah and what she's going through is what nobody should have to go through so publicly.

(Image: Daily Mirror)

Video Loading Video Unavailable Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now

"She's got people saying they hope her baby dies inside her, she's seven months pregnant, she's had to take her daughter out of school."

Nicola believes all of the memes and trolling isn't justified, and thinks people should stop talking about the issue until it's proven that it was Rebekah behind the leaks.

She added: "She's devastated she doesn't see the funny side of this but we're all sitting here and laughing about it."

Lizzie Cundy

(Image: ITV)

Neutral

Despite believing Coleen has "100% proof" of Rebekah's actions, Lizzie Cundy, 49, is on the fence.

Speaking on This Morning, she said she hoped to mediate between the pair.

She said: "I just hope we can sort this out. I think we should sit round a table and get to the bottom of it rather than get all legal and public.

"Coleen is a very honest and lovely girl. She would never have gone and outed someone publicly like this if she didn't have 100% proof."

(Image: Twitter)

Video Loading Video Unavailable Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now

Lizzie, who was married to former Chelsea striker Jason Cundy, admitted she was shocked by the revelations.

She added: "I couldn't quite believe it. Especially being Becky Vardy. I thought why would Becky do this? She doesn't need the money or fame.

"I can only think it's to score brownie points with the journalists."

Chantelle Heskey

(Image: BBC)

Team Coleen

Chantelle Heskey, the wife of ex England striker Emile Hesky, is supporting Coleen as she's also had stories sold about her in the past.

She said when she first began dating her now husband Emile she discovered stories about her were being leaked to the press by a 'snake in her camp.'

Speaking on the Victoria Derbyshire show, she said: "Yeah, it did happen from my close knit circle of family and friends. Things that he'd bought me, places we'd been, things I was wearing were popping up in the newspapers.

"It is heartbreaking to think that someone so close to you would sell stories and leak things like that so I totally get where [Coleen's] coming from."
description: Coleen accused Rebekah of selling stories about her after she allegedly caught her lifting posts from a private account
